prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Summarized Context:
The witness Crab explains why it was impossible to drain the pool where the orca lives unless the pool was being cleaned. When the pool is being cleaned, this is the only time when the orca is moved to another tank.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: A new lawyer at my agency. She studied psychology while she was in Europe.
Character 1
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: An ardent young lawyer in my agency. His special feature is his very loud voice.
Character 2
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: My daughter, who also happens to be an aspiring magician. I adopted her eight years ago.
Character 3
Name: Sasha Buckler
Description: An orca trainer and performer in the Swashbuckler Spectacular. She appears to be best friends with Orla.
Character 4
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He sure makes a lot of noise, but he appears to be on the side of justice.
Character 5
Name: Ora Shipley
Description: The orca accused of murder. Though "Ora" is her real name, people like to call her "Orla". She likes to wear hats.
Character 6
Name: Jack Shipley
Description: The owner of Shipshape Aquarium. He was found dead in the orca pool.
Character 7
Name: Norma DePlume
Description: An aquarium visitor. She seems to know something about what happened.
Character 8
Name: Marlon Rimes
Description: Shipshape Aquarium's new animal keeper. He loves animals as much as he loves rapping.
Character 9
Name: Rifle
Description: A penguin that always shoots straight at her mark. She seems to love the smell of fish.
Character 10
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: A spirit medium in training. Her psychic powers are beyond question.
Character 11
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Character 12
Name: Herman Crab
Description: Shipshape Aquarium's resident vet. A baby penguin lives in his hair.
Character 13
Name: Azura Summers
Description: The trainer who preceded Sasha. She died during a show on July 20th last year.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Swashbuckler Flyer
Description: An advertisement showing an orca dressed up like a pirate. It was dropped by a penguin. An advertisement for a new show. It was dropped by a penguin. An advertisement for a new show. It appears that Sasha was not slated to return.
Evidence 2
Name: Photo of the Body
Description: A crime scene photo taken in the orca pool room. It's hard to make out details of the body. Crime scene photos taken in the orca pool room. (2 photos.)
Evidence 3
Name: Orca Pool Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. The pool is about 65 feet deep. A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. Pearls apparently entered the staff corridor. It also has information about the area around the orca pool on the first and second floor. The pool is about 65 feet deep.
Evidence 4
Name: Whistle
Description: A whistle for issuing instructions to Orla. Anyone can use one to command her, as long as they know the right signals. Orla performs one trick per signal. She can't do two at a time.
Evidence 5
Name: Security Footage
Description: Video showing the orca pool from the visitor's corridor. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. Video showing the orca pool. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. (2 pages.)
Evidence 6
Name: Fish
Description: A large quantity of fish for feeding Rifle the penguin. Not surprisingly, it has a horribly fishy smell!
Evidence 7
Name: Walkie-Talkie
Description: Issued to all aquarium staff for communication. It can apparently also be used to broadcast inside the aquarium.
Evidence 8
Name: Calendar
Description: A penguin-shaped calendar that Pearls bought at the aquarium. It smells fishy for some reason. Apparently belongs to Rimes. It was accidently [sic] switched with Pearls's calendar around 10:10 AM. Apparently belongs to Sasha. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th. It turns out this doesn't belong to Sasha. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th. A calendar that Azura Summers gave to Dr. Crab. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th.
Evidence 9
Name: Bloodstained Coin
Description: A single coin seems to have fallen by the side of the orca pool. Discovered by the side of the orca pool. There are 300 coins in all, weighing 7 pounds total. This makes it a likely murder weapon.
Evidence 10
Name: Swashbuckler Video
Description: A TV recording of a performance featuring Orla, Sasha and Jack Shipley as pirates. The show song on the video is different from the one DePlume heard.
Evidence 11
Name: TV Phone
Description: A cell phone used by Shipshape Aquarium staff. This model can connect to TVs and be used to conduct teleconferencing. Summers's boyfriend has videos of her using a whistle to make the orca do tricks. A cell phone used by Shipshape Aquarium staff. Videos of Summers can be viewed. (2 pages.)
Evidence 12
Name: Shipley's Data
Description: Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body. [info] Cause of Death: Contusion from head trauma. Bruised all over body. Death thought to be result of orca attack. Estimated Time of Death: Under Investigation. Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body. Details updated. [info] Est. Time of Death: From 12:00 to 10:00 AM on July 20th. Cause of Death: Contusion from head trauma. Thought to be from 65-ft fall into pool. Bruised all over. Ceiling to pool bottom is 100 ft. Blow to head received after death. Shipley's walkie-talkie hasn't been found. (3 pages.)
Evidence 13
Name: "The Killer Killer Whale"
Description: A nonfiction book by Norma DePlume. It's about the case from last year.
Evidence 14
Name: Security Card
Description: A key card for gaining access to the orca pool. Only the victim and Sasha had one.
Evidence 15
Name: Prescription Bag
Description: Seized from Sasha's residence. She apparently had this filled at the Hickfield Clinic.
Evidence 16
Name: Skull Rock
Description: There's a bloodstain on the rock. The victim may have struck it when he fell to his death. A new show prop that was at the orca pool. The victim struck it when he fell. Moved from the show pool during cleaning time. The victim struck it when he fell to his death. The victim slammed into it when he fell. Orla also rammed into it. It had been moved from the show pool.
Evidence 17
Name: Pool Bottom Photo
Description: A photo of the bottom of the pool. The locations of the bloodstains detected with luminol are sketched in. [caption] The pool is partitioned into two sections by a tall glass.
Evidence 18
Name: Mysterious Capsule → "3 Zs" Sleeping Pill
Description: The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. "3 Zs" is printed on it. The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. It's a sleeping pill, not some kind of poison.
Evidence 19
Name: Handmade Sign
Description: A sign Sasha made for the new show. It's been left to dry since the early hours of the 20th.
Evidence 20
Name: Ladder Prints
Description: The fingerprints discovered by Pearls at the show stage. They're Rimes's, but there's something odd about them.
Evidence 21
Name: Charm
Description: Discovered in Rifle's stomach. It might belong to Azura Summers's boyfriend.
Evidence 22
Name: TORPEDO Data
Description: TORPEDO data shows that Rifle ate around 4:00 AM on July 20th, but that Orla didn't eat anything.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: In the early morning hours of July 20th, Sasha was cleaning the orca pool room.
Person: Crab
Testimony 1
Testimony: Sasha and Jack Shipley, the owner, were scheduled to do the cleaning together.
Person: Crab
Testimony 2
Testimony: The record of card usage shows that Sasha entered the orca pool room.
Person: Crab
Testimony 3
Testimony: During cleaning, the pool water is drained.
Person: Crab
Testimony 4
Testimony: While the cleaning was going on, Marlon was taking care of the orca in the show pool.
Person: Crab
Testimony 5
Testimony: The pool water would never be drained unless the pool was being cleaned.
Person: Crab
Testimony 6
Testimony: If there were no water in the pool, the orca might die.
Person: Crab

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let me try to figure this out. The user wants to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The answer has to be one pair in JSON. Let's start by going through the testimonies and evidences to see where there's a conflict.

Looking at the testimonies by Crab: Testimony 3 says "During cleaning, the pool water is drained." Then Testimony 5 adds, "The pool water would never be drained unless the pool was being cleaned." So Crab is asserting that the only time the pool is drained is during cleaning, which requires moving the orca to another tank.

Now, check the evidences. Evidence 12 (Shipley's Data) mentions that the estimated time of death is between 12:00 and 10:00 AM on July 20th. Wait, that's a bit confusing. Wait, the original time of death was under investigation, but the updated info says "Est. Time of Death: From 12:00 to 10:00 AM on July 20th." Wait, that's a 14-hour window? Maybe a typo? Or perhaps it's from 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM? Let me check again. The user wrote: "Estimated Time of Death: From 12:00 to 10:00 AM on July 20th." Hmm, that seems backwards. Normally, time ranges go from earlier to later. So maybe it's a mistake, and it should be 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM. But assuming the given data is correct, if the time of death is between 12:00 AM (midnight) and 10:00 AM, but Crab's testimony says that the pool was being cleaned in the early morning hours of July 20th (Testimony 0). 

Wait, let me cross-reference. Testimony 0 says Sasha was cleaning the pool in the early morning hours of the 20th. Testimony 3 and 5 say that draining only happens during cleaning. So if the pool was drained during cleaning, then the orca was moved. But the body was found in the orca pool. However, the cause of death according to Evidence 12 is a contusion from a 65-foot fall into the pool. The pool's depth is 65 feet, but the ceiling to pool bottom is 100 feet. So the victim fell from somewhere high, possibly the ceiling? But if the pool was being cleaned (thus drained), then how did he fall into the pool if there's no water? Unless the pool wasn't drained yet. Wait, the timing here is crucial.

If the pool was being cleaned in the early morning (say, like 2-4 AM), and during that time the water was drained, then the victim couldn't have drowned or been attacked by the orca in the pool during that time. However, the updated time of death in Evidence 12 is from 12:00 (midnight) to 10:00 AM. If the pool was drained during cleaning (early morning), but the time of death includes times when the pool was drained, then the body might have been placed there when the pool was empty, but the cause of death is a fall into the pool. But if the pool was drained, there's no water to fall into. That's a contradiction. So if the victim died from a fall into the pool (which requires water to create the impact), but the pool was drained at the time of death (during cleaning), then the evidence and testimony contradict.

Alternatively, the Skull Rock (Evidence 16) mentions the victim struck it when he fell to his death, and it was moved from the show pool during cleaning time. So if the pool was being cleaned (water drained), the rock was moved there, and the victim fell onto the rock in the drained pool. But the cause of death is a contusion from a fall into the pool (implying water). But if the pool was drained, the fall would be onto the rock or the empty pool floor. So Evidence 12 states the cause of death as a contusion from a 65-ft fall (the depth of the pool), suggesting he fell into water. But Crab's testimony says during cleaning, the pool is drained. So if the pool was drained when he fell, he couldn't have fallen into water, contradicting the cause of death. Therefore, Evidence 12 (Shipley's Data) contradicts Testimony 3 and 5. But the user wants only one pair. So which testimony? Testimony 5 says the pool is only drained during cleaning, and during cleaning, the water is drained (Testimony 3). So if the time of death was during the cleaning time (when the pool was drained), but the cause of death is a fall into the pool (implying water), that's a contradiction. Therefore, Evidence 12 (which states the cause as a fall into the pool, which would require water) contradicts Testimony 3 (which says during cleaning, water is drained). So the pair would be Evidence 12 and Testimony 3.

{"evidence": 12, "testimony": 3}

response:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence contradicts one of Rimes' testimonies. Let's start by looking at the testimonies from Rimes.

Testimony 3 says that Orla killed the captain by bashing him thirty feet high and making him slam into the water. The key point here is the height—thirty feet—and the cause of death being impact with the water.

Now, looking at the evidence. Evidence 12 (Shipley's Data) mentions the cause of death is a brain contusion from a fall into the pool, with the ceiling to pool bottom being 100 feet. It also states there's a blow to the head received after death. Wait, the estimated time of death was updated to between 12:00 and 10:00 AM on July 20th. The contusion is thought to be from a 65-foot fall into the pool, but the ceiling to pool bottom is 100 feet. Hmm. Also, the Orca Pool Diagram (Evidence 3) says the pool is about 65 feet deep. So if the victim fell from the ceiling, which is 100 feet above the pool bottom, that's a 100-foot fall. But the testimony says thirty feet high. Wait, maybe Rimes is saying the orca threw him 30 feet up, leading to a fall into the water. But according to the evidence, the actual fall height would be from 100 feet (ceiling to pool bottom), but the pool itself is 65 feet deep. Wait, maybe the diagram shows that the pool's depth is 65 feet, but the total height from ceiling to pool bottom is 100 feet. So if the victim fell from the ceiling (say, the second floor), that's a 100-foot drop. But Rimes is claiming the orca bashed him 30 feet high, which would be a 30-foot fall. But according to the evidence, the cause of death is a 65-foot fall (since the pool is 65 feet deep, maybe the fall was from the top of the pool's edge?), but the ceiling is higher. Wait, the Shipley's Data says "Estimated Time of Death... Cause of Death: Contusion from head trauma. Thought to be from 65-ft fall into pool." So the medical conclusion is that the victim fell 65 feet into the pool, leading to the fatal injury. However, Rimes is saying the orca threw him 30 feet into the air, which would result in a 30-foot fall. But a 30-foot fall might not be enough to cause the fatal injuries described in Evidence 12, which attributes death to a 65-foot fall. Therefore, Rimes' testimony about the 30-foot height contradicts the evidence that the death was due to a 65-foot fall. That's a contradiction. So the testimony 3 (which is about the 30-foot height) is contradicted by evidence 12, which states the fall was 65 feet. That's the pair.

{"evidence": 12, "testimony": 3}
